feed.title: NewsTracker: ferguson
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Labor formally condemns Ferguson
entry.summary:
Former federal minister Martin Ferguson has been condemned by the ALP as a disgrace.

Mr Crumlin told the conference he was ashamed of Mr Ferguson, who left federal parliament in 2013.

entry.title: Martin Ferguson condemned at Labor national conference over privatisation comments
entry.summary: "Martin Ferguson does not deserve to be considered a Labor elder and must be condemned as a disgraced former Labor politician."

entry.title: Ferguson hires Arizona black police commander as interim chief
entry.summary: Andre Anderson speaks with Ferguson City Council member Wesley Bell, right, after being introduced as the the interim chief of the Ferguson Police Department during a news conference on Wednesday, July 22, 2015, in Ferguson, Mo.

entry.title: Ferguson, Missouri, taps interim police chief who backs changes
entry.summary:
Anderson is taking a six-month leave of absence from the Glendale force and will begin working as interim Ferguson police chief on Thursday, Ferguson officials said.

The current interim chief, Al Eickhoff, joined the department in 2014 under Jackson and will resume his duties as assistant police chief, Ferguson officials said.

entry.title: Ferguson hires black police chief
entry.summary: He said he is interested in becoming Ferguson's permanent police chief.

entry.title: Ferguson Hires Interim Police Chief
entry.summary: The Ferguson police force has changed leadership again, with a third chief in four months.

entry.title: Ferguson hires new interim police chief
entry.summary: Anderson previously was police commander in the Phoenix suburb of Glendale, Arizona - the same city from which Ferguson recently hired its interim city manager, Ed Beasley.

entry.title: Federal judge narrows Brown family lawsuit against Ferguson
entry.summary: Webber says he dismissed two "redundant" counts against former Ferguson Police Chief Thomas Jackson and former Officer Darren Wilson.

entry.title: Federal Report Faults Police Actions During Ferguson Unrest
entry.summary:
The summary is part of a longer after-action report to be released in the coming weeks focusing on the actions of police in Ferguson, St. Louis city and county and the Missouri State Highway Patrol.

The report suggests that the protests after Brown's death on Aug. 9 were aggravated by the community's hostility toward Ferguson police and worsened when authorities didn't quickly divulge details of his death.

The office, which also conducts after-action reports on high-profile police responses, said Tuesday it'll release its final report on the Ferguson response in coming weeks.

entry.title: Federal report faults police actions during Ferguson unrest
entry.summary: "The protests were ... also a manifestation of the long-standing tension between the Ferguson (Police Department) and the African-American community," the report summary stated.

entry.title: Vandals target Confederate monuments in half-dozen states
entry.summary: Confederate monuments in a half-dozen places this week have been defaced _ a telling sign of the racial tension that permeates post-Ferguson America.

entry.title: Vandals target Confederate monuments in half-dozen states
entry.summary:
The graffiti reflects the racial tension that permeates post-Ferguson America, more than a week after a white gunman shot and killed nine black congregants at a Charleston, South Carolina, church.

One of the defaced monuments was the Confederate Memorial in St. Louis' Forest Park, 10 miles from Ferguson.
